text: The Goliath birdeater spider is one of the biggest spiders in the world. It is a tarantula. It lives in burrows in swampy areas of northen South America. It eats insects, rodents, bats, small birds, lizards, frogs, and snakes. The spiders have fangs, but their venom is harmless to people. Hairs on their bodies can irritate human skin. Explorers named the spider when they saw one eating a hummingbird. The female lays 100 to 200 eggs. The babies hatch in two months. The female spiders sometimes eat their mates. Females can live about 20 years, but males only live 3 to 6 years. These spiders can have a leg span of up to and a body length of up to . They can weigh up to .Goliath Bird- Eating Spider , Arkive The spider's living areas are threatened by real estate development. == References == * Smithsonian Institution *Top 10 Real Life Monsters *Goliath Bird Eating Spider ==Other websites== *Caring for your Goliath Bird Eating Tarantula Category:Mygalomorphae
title: Goliath birdeater spider
